FuncDef:
The constant-index command configures a constant index for an IPv4 address pool, IPv6 prefix pool, or IPv6 address pool.
By default, an IPv4 address pool, IPv6 prefix pool, or IPv6 address pool does not have the constant index.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an index for an IPv4 address pool, IPv6 prefix pool, or IPv6 address pool.
The value is an integer ranging from:0 to 4095 for IPv4 address pools0 to 1023 for IPv6 prefix pools0 to 1023 for IPv6 address pools

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After the ip-pool constant-index enable command is configured on a device where IPv4 address pools, IPv6 prefix pools, and IPv6 address pools reside, indexes for these pools remain unchanged after the device is restarted. The constant-index command is automatically generated in corresponding IPv4 address pool, IPv6 prefix pool, and IPv6 address pool views. But the constant-index command cannot be used to change the automatically generated constant index for an IP pool.
Prerequisites
The ip-pool constant-index enable command has been run in the system view.
Configuration Impact
The constant-index command does not have the undo form. The constant-index command is automatically deleted from IPv4 address pool, IPv6 prefix pool, and IPv6 address pool views when the undo ip-pool constant-index enable command is run.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
